subject: Re: How to test private methods in a class.
msgSnippet: For those who don t know, give JunitX 5.2 a try. This version of JUnitX (still a JUnit extension) eases all private stuff testing. The reflection stuff is done
messageBody:
For those who don't know, give JunitX 5.2 a try. This version of
JUnitX (still a JUnit extension) eases all private stuff testing. The
reflection stuff is done for you. Thanks to javassist, you don't have
to create any extra classes (TestProxy classes) anymore.

Have a look at this "how to" where you can also find the jar file:

http://www.xp-swiss.org/wiki/index.php?title=JUnitX_how_to_eng

Jérôme.
